stack writes:
> Yeah.  We've seen this on occasion.  Odd is how the exception message is 
> 'null' in the above.  I assume you have plenty disk and none of the 
> other logs are throwing IOExceptions anywhere?

Yeah, that threw me for a loop as well. No IO exceptions and around
100G available disk space.

> These are System.out prints from the ExtractorSWF.  Need to make a build 
> that turns these emissions off.

OK.

> On the OOMEs, I do not have ideas.  With so few seeds, you shouldn't be 
> seeing OOMEs.  Whats your frontier report say about queues, etc.?  
> Anything exotic about your order file -- other than the locations you're 
> visiting?
> 
> Since you're running 1.5.0 JVM, you might send over the output from running
> 
> % $JAVA_HOME/bin/jmap -histo PID
> 
> This does a dump of heap instances and sizes.

I've already killed the heritrix instance. But the next time this
happens I'll run this.

The order is the one I sent a while back, which includes a mid-fetch
filter and various other filters limiting saved content to text/html.

    -tree
